subject: Re: [junit] Tool that shows which test(s) cover lines in class under test?
msgSnippet: You could derive the information with EMMA, but it would require that you do a little work: 1. run each test case as a separate EMMA execution 2. analyze the
messageBody:
You could derive the information with EMMA, but it would require that you do
a little work:
1. run each test case as a separate EMMA execution
2. analyze the report files for code coverage

It has been a long time since I looked at the emma coverage data, but I"m
pretty sure you can examine w/ a Java app to generate the type of data you
want.

Michael Giroux

On 3/21/06, Bradley, Todd <todd.bradley@...> wrote:
>
> Sounds like a cool feature. I don't believe EMMA does
> that. If you find a tool that does, please pass on the
> info.
>
>
> Thanks,
> Todd.
>
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On
> > Behalf Of jason r tibbetts
> > Sent: Tuesday, March 21, 2006 1:43 PM
> > To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> > Subject: [junit] Tool that shows which test(s) cover lines in
> > class under test?
> >
> > I've worked with jCoverage and Cobertura for the past several months.
> > However, I'd like to find a tool that will display, for each
> > line of the class under test, which unit tests actually
> > executed that line. Simply stating that X line was executed Y
> > times is of marginal use to me if I can't map back to see
> > exactly /how/ that line was executed. I don't recall whether
> > EMMA does this. Any other suggestions? Commercial version of
> > jCoverage?
> >
> > Why do I need this? At first, I created a custom Javadoc
> > taglet that developers would add to their class-under-test's
> > method comments, to the tune of:
> >
> > /**
> > * @... = FooTest#testAddBar()
> > * @... = FooTest#testAddThreeBars()
> > */
> > public void addBar(Bar bar) { ... }
> >
> > This would insert appropriate Javadoc links to the relevant
> > test methods. But this is unwieldy, and certainly an
> > unrealistic requirement for the developers.
> >
> >
> >
> > Yahoo! Groups Links
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
>
>
>
> Yahoo! Groups Links
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
